snippet: Medicare does not cover all health expenses, so out-of-pocket costs could include deductibles, prescription premiums, eye exams and glasses, hearing aids and perhaps long-term care.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column warns that many people do not plan financially for health expenses that are not covered by Medicare, including deductibles, prescription premiums and other out-of-pocket costs.
lead_paragraph: Medicare does not cover all health expenses, so out-of-pocket costs could include deductibles, prescription premiums, eye exams and glasses, hearing aids and perhaps long-term care.

headline.print_headline: Planning for Retirement? Don’t Forget Health Care Costs
headline.seo: Planning for Health Care Costs in Retirement
headline.main: Planning for Retirement? Don’t Forget Health Care Costs
